dt-example.title: Default sorting
dt-example.info:
With DataTables you can alter the sorting characteristics of the table at initialisation time. Using the `dt-init sorting` initialisation parameter, you can set the table to display the data in exactly the order that you want.
The `dt-init sorting` parameter is an array of arrays where the first value of the inner array is the column to sort on, and the second is `string 'asc'` (ascending sorting) or `string 'desc'` (descending sorting) as required. `dt-init sorting` is a 2D array to allow multi-column sorting to be defined.
The table below is sorted (descending) by the Age column.
